fields.name: What happened to the "Apple Music Electron"
fields.value: Apple Music Electron is now discontinued. Instead there is now Cider! Cider isn't just a modded version of the Apple Music website, it's a standalone application that's been programmed from scratch!

fields.name: What is Cider?
fields.value: Cider is an open source and cross-platform Apple Music client, with support for Apple Podcasts. It's fast and beautiful.

embeds.title: How can I get Cider?
embeds.description:
If you want the **most stable** experience, you can get  <:canary:936787944843378709> Cider (Alpha) from: 
 - [<:MicrosoftStore:967950621225394256> Microsoft Store](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/p/cider-alpha/9p21xj9d9g66) (All proceeds go directly to our [OpenCollective](https://opencollective.com/ciderapp/))

We offer more releases in our GitHub, (also for other OS such as linux and macOS) you can access them using the `/branchbuilds` command and specify the branch you want to compile from.

<:stable:936789492218609674> `stable` - This is compiled from the stable branch in GitHub, which is tested thoroughly and has minimal bugs. These builds are kept in sync with Microsoft Store builds.
<:stable:936789492218609674> `main` - This is for people who live in the bleeding edge and want the latest features and fixes. Once features are ready for deployment, they are merged with this branch.

<:stable:936789492218609674> [macOS builds](https://github.com/ciderapp/Cider/releases/tag/macos-beta) of Cider are compiled by maintainers and can be accessed using the `/macos` command, it provides both a .dmg and .pkg file.

If you want to compile <:canary:936787944843378709> **Cider** for your system, you may do so, docs for compiling are listed below:
- <a:processing:967950621338665000> [Cider Docs for Compiling](https://docs.cider.sh/compilation)

embeds.title: What's the difference between all of them?
embeds.description:
<:canary:936787944843378709> [**Cider** (Alpha)](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/p/cider-alpha/9p21xj9d9g66) is the Microsoft Store version which is updated weekly (usually) and is the most stable release.

<:stable:936789492218609674> [**Cider** (stable branch)](https://github.com/ciderapp/cider-releases/releases?q=main) is the second most stable release, this updates every time the main branch is stable enough to be merged. These builds are kept in sync with Microsoft Store builds.

<:stable:936789492218609674> [**Cider Beta** (main branch)](https://github.com/ciderapp/cider-releases/releases?q=main) this is the most bleeding edge and where most of the updates first happen. These releases are fairly unstable and are not intended for daily use. There is a new alpha build for every commit and PR, so it requires a little bit of manual updating.

<a:processing:967950621338665000> Compiling your own version of Cider requires manually pulling and compiling per commit. 
**DO NOT USE IF YOU DO NOT KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING**

fields.name: Does Cider supports Lossless Audio?
fields.value: Cider does not currently support lossless audio. This is because the core software Apple has forced us to use does not yet support it. If one day Apple adds support for lossless audio to this software, we'll add it to Cider. Cider only supports up to 256 kbps AAC at the moment.

fields.name: How about Dolby Atmos and Spatial Audio?
fields.value:
Unfortunately, Dolby Atmos and Spatial Audio stuff also works as stated in the question above. It's impossible for us to get them to work without Apple adding support. 
However You may want to try `Cider Tuned Audio Spatialization` made by Maikiwi which sounds close to Atmos.

embeds.title: How can I support this project?

fields.name: Donate
fields.value: You can donate to our [OpenCollective](https://opencollective.com/ciderapp), via [Ko-Fi](https://ko-fi.com/cryptofyre) or via [GitHub Sponsors](https://github.com/sponsors/ciderapp)

fields.name: How do I connect Last.fm?
fields.value: Click your profile picture in the bottom left<a:righter_arrow:967950621338640424> Settings <a:righter_arrow:967950621338640424> Connectivity <a:righter_arrow:967950621338640424> Connect Last.fm

fields.name: Why did Last.fm Scrobbling break?
fields.value:
We changed the API key (we do this for various reasons, not important)

Steps to fix:
1. Disconnect Last.fm in Cider
2. Exit Cider
3. Delete %appdata%/Cider/session.json
4. Open Cider and connect Last.fm in Settings again
